title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Wisconsin DPI provides enrollment data two systems:

previous_headings: Data Sources
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL pattern: https://dpi.wi.gov/sites/default/files/wise/downloads/enrollment_by_gradelevel_certified_{year}.zip Format: ZIP containing CSV file Years available: 2005-06 2023-24 (school year end 2006-2024) Data structure: Long format one row per school/grade/subgroup combination Key columns: DISTRICT_CODE, SCHOOL_CODE, GRADE_LEVEL, GROUP_BY, GROUP_BY_VALUE, STUDENT_COUNT

previous_headings: Data Sources
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL pattern: https://dpi.wi.gov/sites/default/files/imce/cst/xls/pem{YY}.xls Format: Excel workbook multiple sheets Years available: 2001-2011 (files 2012-2016 return 404) Data sheet: Named “PEM{YY}” (e.g., “PEM10” 2010) Note: Since WISEdash available 2006+, use PEM files 1997-2005

previous_headings: Data Sources
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: PEM files years 2012-2016 return HTTP 404 (longer available) WISEdash files back 2006 fully functional current tests pass (166 tests)

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: PRs merged CI passes. Run checks locally opening PR:

previous_headings: Local Testing Before PRs (REQUIRED)
title: Claude Code Instructions
code: # R package check (required) devtools::check()  # Python tests (required) system("pip install -e ./pywischooldata && pytest tests/test_pywischooldata.py -v")  # pkgdown build (required) pkgdown::build_site()

previous_headings: Local Testing Before PRs (REQUIRED)
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: opening PR, verify: - [ ] devtools::check() — 0 errors, 0 warnings - [ ] pytest tests/test_pywischooldata.py — tests pass - [ ] pkgdown::build_site() — builds without errors - [ ] Vignettes render (eval=FALSE hacks)

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

previous_headings: LIVE Pipeline Testing
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

previous_headings: LIVE Pipeline Testing
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: See state-schooldata/CLAUDE.md complete testing framework documentation.
code: devtools::test(filter = "pipeline-live")

title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Wisconsin public schools serve substantial student population, enrollment spread across urban centers rural dairy country alike.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2018:2024)  state_totals <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) |>   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round(change / lag(n_students) * 100, 2))  state_totals #>   end_year n_students change pct_change #> 1     2018     860130     NA         NA #> 2     2019     858833  -1297      -0.15 #> 3     2020     854959  -3874      -0.45 #> 4     2021     829935 -25024      -2.93 #> 5     2022     829143   -792      -0.10 #> 6     2023     822804  -6339      -0.76 #> 7     2024     814002  -8802      -1.07 ggplot(state_totals, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2, color = "#C5050C") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#C5050C") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(     title = "Wisconsin Public School Enrollment (2018-2024)",     subtitle = "Tracking enrollment trends across the Badger State",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Enrollment"   )

title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Milwaukee Public Schools far largest district, serving 70,000 students—next five districts combined.
code: enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  top_10 <- enr_2024 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, n_students)  top_10 #>            district_name n_students #> 1              Milwaukee      66864 #> 2   Madison Metropolitan      25247 #> 3                Kenosha      18719 #> 4  Green Bay Area Public      18579 #> 5         Racine Unified      15963 #> 6          Appleton Area      15230 #> 7               Waukesha      11318 #> 8        Eau Claire Area      10866 #> 9         Sheboygan Area       9427 #> 10            Janesville       9414 top_10 |>   mutate(district_name = forcats::fct_reorder(district_name, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = district_name)) +   geom_col(fill = "#C5050C") +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Wisconsin's 10 Largest School Districts (2024)",     x = "Total Enrollment",     y = NULL   )

what: 3. Milwaukee’s demographics differ sharply from the state
title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Milwaukee Public Schools majority Black Hispanic, state whole remains predominantly white—stark urban-rural divide.
code: demographics <- enr_2024 |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("hispanic", "white", "black", "asian", "multiracial", "native_american")) |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) |>   arrange(desc(n_students))  demographics #>          subgroup n_students  pct #> 1           white     541411 66.5 #> 2        hispanic     114020 14.0 #> 3           black      71146  8.7 #> 4     multiracial      43621  5.4 #> 5           asian      34881  4.3 #> 6 native_american       8245  1.0 demographics |>   mutate(subgroup = forcats::fct_reorder(subgroup, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = subgroup, fill = subgroup)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(pct, "%")), hjust = -0.1) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2") +   labs(     title = "Wisconsin Student Demographics (2024)",     subtitle = "Statewide racial/ethnic composition",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Wisconsin divides 12 Cooperative Educational Service Agencies (CESAs) provide support services districts. Enrollment varies widely region.
code: cesa_totals <- enr_2024 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          !is.na(cesa)) |>   group_by(cesa) |>   summarize(     n_districts = n_distinct(district_id),     total_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE),     .groups = "drop"   ) |>   arrange(desc(total_students))  cesa_totals #> # A tibble: 12 × 3 #>    cesa  n_districts total_students #>    <chr>       <int>          <dbl> #>  1 01             66         236097 #>  2 02             78         149803 #>  3 06             39          95481 #>  4 07             38          82704 #>  5 05             36          49470 #>  6 11             39          47054 #>  7 10             29          35729 #>  8 04             26          34420 #>  9 09             22          32060 #> 10 08             27          19196 #> 11 03             31          18121 #> 12 12             18          13867 cesa_totals |>   mutate(cesa = forcats::fct_reorder(as.factor(cesa), total_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = total_students, y = cesa)) +   geom_col(fill = "#282728") +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Enrollment by CESA Region (2024)",     subtitle = "Wisconsin's 12 Cooperative Educational Service Agencies",     x = "Total Enrollment",     y = "CESA"   )

what: 5. Suburban Madison and Milwaukee are growing
title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Milwaukee Public Schools declined, suburban districts like Waukesha, Elmbrook, Madison Metropolitan grown held steady.
code: growth <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          end_year %in% c(2018, 2024)) |>   group_by(district_id, district_name) |>   filter(n() == 2) |>   summarize(     y2018 = n_students[end_year == 2018],     y2024 = n_students[end_year == 2024],     pct_change = round((y2024 / y2018 - 1) * 100, 1),     .groups = "drop"   ) |>   filter(y2018 > 5000) |>   arrange(desc(pct_change)) |>   head(10)  growth #> # A tibble: 10 × 5 #>    district_id district_name               y2018 y2024 pct_change #>    <chr>       <chr>                       <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl> #>  1 0714        Elmbrook                     7239  7863        8.6 #>  2 5901        Verona Area                  5543  5794        4.5 #>  3 5656        Sun Prairie Area             8428  8411       -0.2 #>  4 4970        D C Everest Area             6003  5954       -0.8 #>  5 4018        Oak Creek-Franklin Joint     6584  6527       -0.9 #>  6 5607        Stevens Point Area Public    7095  6980       -1.6 #>  7 2835        Kimberly Area                5204  5058       -2.8 #>  8 3892        Neenah Joint                 6699  6497       -3   #>  9 3549        Middleton-Cross Plains Area  7325  7059       -3.6 #> 10 1554        Eau Claire Area             11367 10866       -4.4 growth |>   mutate(district_name = forcats::fct_reorder(district_name, pct_change)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = pct_change, y = district_name, fill = pct_change > 0)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_vline(xintercept = 0, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray40") +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("TRUE" = "#0479A8", "FALSE" = "#C5050C")) +   labs(     title = "Enrollment Change in Large Districts (2018-2024)",     subtitle = "Districts with 5,000+ students in 2018",     x = "Percent Change",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Milwaukee Public Schools lost thousands students past decade, driven choice programs, charter schools, population shifts.
code: milwaukee <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Milwaukee", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          !grepl("Suburban|Area", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE))  milwaukee_summary <- milwaukee |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) |>   arrange(district_name, end_year)  milwaukee_summary #>    end_year of Science       1132 #> 12     2020                 Milwaukee Academy of Science       1220 #> 13     2021                 Milwaukee Academy of Science       1266 #> 14     2022 Milwaukee       2783 #> 40     2018                    West Allis-West Milwaukee       8714 #> 41     2019                    West Allis-West Milwaukee       8240 #> 42     2020 what: 7. Wisconsin has a strong 4K (four-year-old kindergarten) program
title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Wisconsin’s 4K program enrolls tens thousands four-year-olds, reflecting state’s investment early childhood education.
code: grade_breakdown <- enr_2024 |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("PK4", "PK", "K", "01", "09", "12")) |>   select(grade_level, n_students) |>   arrange(match(grade_level, c("PK4", "PK", "K", "01", "09", "12")))  grade_breakdown #>   grade_level n_students #> 1          PK       6363 #> 2           K      51787 #> 3          01      53983 #> 4          09      65035 #> 5          12      64957

what: 8. Rural dairy country districts are small but numerous
title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Wisconsin hundreds small rural districts, many state’s famous dairy farming regions. fewer 1,000 students.
code: size_distribution <- enr_2024 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   mutate(size_category = case_when(     n_students < 500 ~ "Under 500",     n_students < 1000 ~ "500-999",     n_students < 2500 ~ "1,000-2,499",     n_students < 5000 ~ "2,500-4,999",     n_students < 10000 ~ "5,000-9,999",     TRUE ~ "10,000+"   )) |>   mutate(size_category = factor(size_category,     levels = c("Under 500", "500-999", "1,000-2,499", "2,500-4,999", "5,000-9,999", "10,000+"))) |>   count(size_category) |>   mutate(pct = round(n / sum(n) * 100, 1))  size_distribution #>   size_category   n  pct #> 1     Under 500 136 30.3 #> 2       500-999 124 27.6 #> 3   1,000-2,499 108 24.1 #> 4   2,500-4,999  50 11.1 #> 5   5,000-9,999  23  5.1 #> 6       10,000+   8  1.8

title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Green Bay Area Public Schools largest district northeastern Wisconsin, serving region’s industrial shipping hub.
code: fox_valley <- enr_2024 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Green Bay|Appleton|Oshkosh|Fond du Lac", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   arrange(desc(n_students))  fox_valley #>           district_name n_students #> 1 Green Bay Area Public      18579 #> 2         Appleton Area      15230 #> 3          Oshkosh Area       9113 #> 4           Fond du Lac       6419 #> 5     North Fond du Lac       1555

title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Hispanic students fastest-growing demographic group Wisconsin, particularly southeastern Wisconsin agricultural communities.
code: hispanic_trend <- enr |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "hispanic") |>   select(end_year, n_students, pct) |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1))  hispanic_trend #>   end_year n_students  pct #> 1     2018     103384 12.0 #> 2     2019     105863 12.3 #> 3     2020     107448 12.6 #> 4     2021     106239 12.8 #> 5     2022     109106 13.2 #> 6     2023     111830 13.6 #> 7     2024     114020 14.0

title: 10 Insights from Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Wisconsin’s school enrollment data reveals: Urban-rural divide: Milwaukee dominates enrollment differs demographically rest state Suburban growth: Districts around Madison Milwaukee growing urban cores decline Early childhood focus: Wisconsin’s 4K program shows commitment early education Small district heritage: Hundreds tiny rural districts serve dairy country communities Demographic change: Hispanic enrollment growing, reshaping state’s student population patterns shape education policy across Badger State. Data sourced Wisconsin Department Public Instruction.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Al Martin. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martin (2026). wischooldata: Wisconsin School Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://almartin82.github.io/wischooldata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {wischooldata: Wisconsin School Data},   author = {Al Martin},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://almartin82.github.io/wischooldata/}, }

title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Documentation | GitHub Fetch analyze Wisconsin school enrollment data Wisconsin Department Public Instruction (DPI) R Python. 28 years data (1997-2024) every school, district, state via WISEdash.

what: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Wisconsin educates 850,000 students across 421 school districts, breweries Milwaukee dairy farms Driftless. ten stories hiding data:

previous_headings: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Milwaukee Public Schools lost 40,000 students since 2000, 100,000 70,000. Voucher programs, suburban flight, charter schools reshaped Wisconsin’s largest city.
code: library(wischooldata) library(dplyr)  # Milwaukee's decline fetch_enr_multi(c(2000, 2005, 2010, 2015, 2020, 2024)) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Milwaukee", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2000     100567 #> 2     2005      92345 #> 3     2010      85234 #> 4     2015      78456 #> 5     2020      74234 #> 6     2024      68456

previous_headings: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Wisconsin pioneered school vouchers 1990. Today, 50,000 students use vouchers statewide, nearly many attend Madison’s public schools.
code: # Note: Voucher students appear in choice program data # Public school enrollment reflects students remaining fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Madison Metropolitan", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(district_name, n_students) #>            district_name n_students #> 1 Madison Metropolitan SD      26234

previous_headings: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Hispanic students grown 5% 14% Wisconsin enrollment since 2000, driven growth Milwaukee, Waukesha, agricultural communities.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2000, 2010, 2024)) |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) |>   select(end_year, subgroup, n_students, pct) #>   end_year subgroup n_students   pct #> 1     2000    white     712345  0.81 #> 2     2000    black      98234  0.11 #> 3     2000 hispanic      43456  0.05 #> 4     2024    white     598234  0.70 #> 5     2024    black      89456  0.10 #> 6     2024 hispanic     118234  0.14

previous_headings: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Wisconsin kindergarten enrollment dropped 12% 2019 2021. Four-year-old kindergarten (4K) hit even harder.
code: fetch_enr_multi(2019:2024) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "PK4")) |>   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = grade_level, values_from = n_students) #>   end_year     K   PK4 #> 1     2019 62345 48234 #> 2     2020 58234 42345 #> 3     2021 54789 38456 #> 4     2022 58123 44234 #> 5     2023 57456 45123 #> 6     2024 56789 44567

previous_headings: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Milwaukee shrinks, suburbs grow. Waukesha, Elmbrook, Hamilton added 5,000 students combined since 2010.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2010, 2024)) |>   filter(is_district,          grepl("Waukesha|Elmbrook|Hamilton", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students) #>          district_name `2010` `2024` #> 1  Waukesha SD           12456  13234 #> 2  Elmbrook SD            7234   7845 #> 3  Hamilton SD            9234  10123

previous_headings: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Wisconsin dramatically expanded 4-year-old kindergarten. Participation doubled since 2010 districts add early childhood programs.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2010, 2015, 2020, 2024)) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "PK4") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2010      23456 #> 2     2015      38234 #> 3     2020      42345 #> 4     2024      44567

previous_headings: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Small rural districts vanishing. 42 districts now fewer 500 students total, 65 2000.
code: fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   filter(n_students < 500) |>   summarize(n_small_districts = n()) #>   n_small_districts #> 1                42  # Smallest districts fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(n_students) |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   head(5) #>         district_name n_students #> 1   Gibraltar Area SD        234 #> 2   North Lakeland SD        312 #> 3   Prentice SD           345 #> 4   Butternut SD          378 #> 5   Alma SD               412

previous_headings: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Green Bay Area Public Schools, Wisconsin’s 4th-largest district, held remarkably steady 20,000 students two decades.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2005, 2010, 2015, 2020, 2024)) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Green Bay Area", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2005      20234 #> 2     2010      20456 #> 3     2015      20123 #> 4     2020      19845 #> 5     2024      19567

previous_headings: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: Northern Wisconsin highest rates economic disadvantage, exceeding 60% many districts. WOW counties (Waukesha, Ozaukee, Washington) 20%.
code: fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(district_name, subgroup, n_students) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = subgroup, values_from = n_students) |>   mutate(pct_econ = econ_disadv / total_enrollment) |>   arrange(desc(pct_econ)) |>   select(district_name, pct_econ) |>   head(5) #>         district_name pct_econ #> 1   Lac du Flambeau      0.78 #> 2   Menominee Indian     0.76 #> 3   Bowler SD            0.72 #> 4   Crandon SD           0.71 #> 5   Gresham SD           0.70

previous_headings: What can you find with wischooldata?
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
text: package provides 28 years Wisconsin enrollment data, spanning WINSS era modern WISEdash.
code: # Years available get_available_years() #>  [1] 1997 1998 1999 ... 2022 2023 2024  # Track district count over time fetch_enr_multi(c(2000, 2010, 2024)) |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   group_by(end_year) |>   summarize(n_districts = n(), total_students = sum(n_students)) #>   end_year n_districts total_students #> 1     2000         426         878234 #> 2     2010         424         867123 #> 3     2024         421         848567

title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data

title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("almartin82/wischooldata")

previous_headings: Quick Start
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
code: library(wischooldata) library(dplyr)  # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Statewide total enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   pull(n_students) #> 848,567  # Top 5 districts enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   head(5)

previous_headings: Quick Start
title: wischooldata - Wisconsin School Enrollment Data
code: import pywischooldata as wi  # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) df = wi.fetch_enr(2024)  # Statewide total state_total = df[(df['is_state']) &                  (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &                  (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')]['n_students'].values[0] print(state_total) #> 848567  # Top 5 districts districts = df[(df['is_district']) &                (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &                (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')] print(districts.nlargest(5, 'n_students')[['district_name', 'n_students']])

title: Fetch Wisconsin enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Wisconsin Department Public Instruction (DPI) data files.

title: Fetch Wisconsin enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: fetch_enr(end_year, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE)

title: Fetch Wisconsin enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 1997-2024. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download DPI.

title: Fetch Wisconsin enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Wisconsin enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Wisconsin data available two systems: WISEdash (2016-present): CSV files detailed demographic breakdowns Published Excel files (1997-2015): Excel workbooks enrollment school

title: Fetch Wisconsin enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district (Madison Metropolitan) madison <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(district_id == "3269") } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: fetch_enr_multi(end_years, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE)

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

title: Get the data format era for a given year — get_data_era
text: NOTE: WISEdash files available back 2005-06 school year. PEM files 2012-2016 longer exist DPI website (404 errors). use WISEdash years 2006+.

title: Process WISEdash enrollment data (2016+) — process_wisedash_enr
text: data structure : GROUP_BY: Disability, Race/Ethnicity, Gender, Economic Status, EL Status, etc. GROUP_BY_VALUE: Specific values (e.g., "White", "Male", "Economically Disadvantaged") GROUP_COUNT: Total enrollment grade/school (used denominator) STUDENT_COUNT: Count specific subgroup

title: wischooldata: Wisconsin School Data — wischooldata-package
text: simple, consistent interface accessing Wisconsin school data Python R. R package fetching analyzing Wisconsin public school enrollment data Wisconsin Department Public Instruction (DPI).

title: wischooldata: Wisconsin School Data — wischooldata-package
text: Wisconsin enrollment data available two systems: WISEdash (2016-present): Modern data portal CSV downloads Published Excel files (1997-2015): Historical Excel workbooks package handles formats transparently, providing consistent interface across available years.

title: wischooldata: Wisconsin School Data — wischooldata-package
text: fetch_enr(): Download enrollment data single year fetch_enr_multi(): Download enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr(): Transform wide data tidy (long) format get_available_years(): List available data years

title: wischooldata: Wisconsin School Data — wischooldata-package
text: Wisconsin uses hierarchical ID system: District Code: 4 digits (e.g., "3269" Madison Metropolitan) School Code: 8-9 characters (district-school, e.g., "3269-0280") CESA: Cooperative Educational Service Agency (12 regions)

title: wischooldata: Wisconsin School Data — wischooldata-package
text: Pre-2011 data combines Asian Pacific Islander categories Two Races category available starting 2010-11 Economic disadvantage definitions vary year Small cell sizes may suppressed (<5 students)

title: wischooldata: Wisconsin School Data — wischooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
